description.narrative: The Project involves providing a long term corporate loan facility of up to US$250 million to Myronivsky Hliboproduct (MHP or the Company), the largest integrated poultry producer in Ukraine, to support the Companys expansion plans in Ukraine and refinance its Eurobond maturity falling due in 2015.

The Project will help facilitate its continued growth in a high potential sector to Ukraine''s economy and strengthen the debt servicing capacity of a leading agribusiness group. Key development impacts of the Project include the following: (i) Support food security: MHP''s overall volumes are expected to increase as a result of the Project and contribute to improved food security in Ukraine and beyond by efficiently converting grain to meat through supporting a leading and efficient poultry producer; (ii) Provide demonstration effect: By supporting MHP, a socially responsible and efficient producer with solid track record, IFC''s investment, which includes a B Loan, will encourage foreign and local investors to invest in Ukraine''s economy in crisis times; (iii) Support job preservation and creation: The Group currently employs 30,000 staff, including 11,400 women. Direct employment is expected to increase as a result of the Project; and (iv) Support inclusiveness: The Company supports a network of 2,600 SMEs, a franchise network of small shops selling MHP branded poultry. Significant number of these SMEs operate in rural locations often underserved in terms of basic food retail reach.

mailing-address.narrative: MHP Headquarters 158, Ak. Zabolotnogo St. Kyiv, 03143 Ukraine
Sobotyuk Anastasiya Head of Investor Relations and Communications Department 158, Ak. Zabolotnogo St. Kyiv, 03143 Ukraine Phone: 38 044 207 00 70

name.narrative: The expansion project linked to the IFC loan is located in a rural area of the Vinnytsia region in Ukraine.

activity-description.narrative: A description that qualifies the activity taking place at the location.

title.narrative: Summary of Investment Information - Anticipated Impact Measurement & Monitoring (AIMM) Assessment and Main Environmental & Social Risks and Impacts of the Project
